tweets.text: Your latest updates from Mytholmroyd Flood Alleviation Scheme üëá Lots of progression as it nears the finish line. #floodaware @VolkerStevinUK @EnvAgencyYNE @ScottAPatient @Calderdale @cathseal1 @mrsk3r https://t.co/NVY3gtWtd3

Here's some time lapse footage of work we've completed in #Doncaster to repair damage to the #flood bank caused by last year's floods. This project will ensure the local community in better protected from the risk of #flooding this winter #WinterReady @BAMNuttall @ArupGroup https://t.co/7FUfXSFh7x

@mrsk3r @CommunitiesPrep @EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group @Calderdale Been a really interesting and engaging series of workshops. Looking forward to the next one. Fundraising so important in these difficult times

Here's our Fisheries Enforcement Officers showing Police Forces in the #NorthWest the various illegal instruments used by poachers for the illegal taking of salmonids and coarse fish.

This partnership work is carried out twice a year with various Police Forces.

#fish https://t.co/hlxA2fbkML

The Fisheries Team in #Cumbria and #Lancashire are working with @AyrshireRT to monitor the numbers of Scottish escapee farmed salmon.

tweets.text:
Never put wet wipes, cotton pads or kitchen roll down the toilet.

They don't break down in the same way as toilet paper - leading to blocked sewers. Only flush the 3 Ps - pee, poo and toilet paper.

Share the video to let others know¬†how to protect¬†their¬†pipes this #Unblocktober https://t.co/2fGsxkivfv

tweets.text:
Our Field Team has been carrying out incident training to make sure they are ready to respond this winter. 

At Mitford Dam, Morpeth, the training included temporary flood barrier deployment and high volume pump testing. 

Read more: https://t.co/pkrUl8yks8

#winter 
#flood https://t.co/OHZpFBiIHp

South Ferriby officers have been preparing for winter by carrying out a practice flooding training exercise.

This included testing the supply of equipment and training contractors. #Flood #Lincolnshire https://t.co/LxTNhm6rkk

The next webinar from @CommunitiesPrep @EnvAgencyYNE is on fundraising, book on for Wed 21st Oct, 6-7.30pm, flood wardens and community groups would benefit from this session. @Tod_Flood_Group @ScottAPatient @Calderdale 
https://t.co/LDen3mRat8

Our trial rain planter is planted up! A lovely bit of greenery has been added to a dreary corner of @SuttonCouncil  offices. These shade-loving plants will not only brighten this space but the planter will store rainwater from the roof saving rain from the drain! #SuDSnotFloods https://t.co/XPGWWqZH6k

tweets.text: We've completed repairs to a 40 metre slip on a flood defence embankment in #Doncaster, as part of our work to repair and improve defences for winter #WinterReady https://t.co/GshNxaUXBI https://t.co/X3VEGmmHnN

Award winning project alert!üö®

We are thrilled that our Lincolnshire beach management scheme has won a silver award at the Considerate Constructors Scheme 2020 awards.

Read more about the project here: https://t.co/izI4vUbVD5 #Lincolnshire @CCScheme #beach #success https://t.co/l1uTnCQVGB

Great to see leaky dams installed on Crompton Moor #Oldham as part of a partnership project to #slowtheflow create habitat & improve our resilience to climate change

Did you know? Leaky dams mimic the natural obstruction of üå≥ & hold back significant volumes of water when it üåßÔ∏è https://t.co/Q6t1VGvDAx

tweets.text:
Chalk streams are a hugely important part of our environment and it‚Äôs our job to protect them.

We recently won the #UKRiverPrize 2020 for our work protecting Hampshire's famous #ChalkStreams - the Test and Itchen rivers.

Read more here: https://t.co/z4UdvGOxg8

@NaturalEngland

Great news for Par & St Blazey. We have received planning permission for flood defence work on Par river and Treffry Canal, part of the multi-million pound StARR project.  https://t.co/utaJNbDMdx @CornwallCouncil

Do you often use cotton balls, pads or buds?
 
Never put them down the loo as they cause blockages and harm our environment. 
 
To protect your pipes and the environment, only flush the three Ps - poo, pee and toilet paper. 

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/of9FDrTe5i

Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people admit to having flushed down the loo. 
 
However, unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve and instead causes blockages. 
 
Never flush kitchen roll. 
 
Protect your pipes and our environment.

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches

No. 8 of 10 spoil heaps we're tackling this year. Toxic chemicals from this mound wash into the river nr #Nenthead and are carried all the way downstream and out to sea at #Tynemouth. We're using natural materials to stabilise it #reducingpollution @EnvAgencyYNE @CoalAuthority https://t.co/yGW6IbjV5X
Yet another reason to raise the profile of #floodrisk in #planning @EnvAgency @floodmary @theTCPA @BritishInsurers https://t.co/oJ4aSz04D6
The Parrett field team started their annual winter maintenance programme this week, photos show the Chinnock Brook before and after. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/LQao9qCJoB
Do you have a permit to break vehicles? If not we have new powers to shut you down. Why risk it? Call us for free advice on how to make your business legal: 03708 506 506. https://t.co/NJ4hF4voX9

Like medieval weapons - 25 of these poles will be hammered into the ground between Egypt's Clyse & King's Sedgemoor Drain (KSD), as base for new culvert. Part of SRA's big Sowy-KSD scheme delivered @EnvAgencySW contractors @LandandWaterCo using #GrowthDeals funding @HeartofSWLEP https://t.co/XgY8tJ5rwL

This week our #SEDisruptionTeam have been conducting spot checks at scrap metal dealers across the region. This is a joint operation with our partners @EnvAgencySE and @WeAreOpenreach to detect metal theft and ensure dealers are complying with regulations. https://t.co/v8vxekGvNP

Great progress has been made to dredge the Steeping River and the Wainfleet relief channel.
